definition: to receive (praise, an education, punishment etc)/to be ...ed (praised, educated, punished etc)
to receive/to accept/to suffer/subjected to/to bear/to stand/pleasant/(passive marker)
to (a place)/until (a time)/up to/to go/to arrive/(verb complement denoting completion or result of an action)

sentences.english: Around 4-6% of elderly people have experienced some form of maltreatment at home.
sentences.chinese: 约有4%到6%的老人在家中受到某种形式的虐待。

sentences.english: The people who allowed torture have faced no punishment at all.
sentences.chinese: 而那些允许酷刑的人却不会受到任何处罚。

sentences.english: Considerable attention is given to the action of centrifugal force in grinding wheels.
sentences.chinese: 磨床砂轮的离心力作用受到相当的关注。

sentences.english: Q. I am an MT4 user, how will my account be affected?
sentences.chinese: 我是一名MT4用户，我的账户会受到甚么样的影响？

sentences.english: Sooner or later, you'llget your conscience smitten.
sentences.chinese: 总有一天，你会受到良心谴责的。

sentences.english: It is the great who is assailed by envy.
sentences.chinese: 正是大人物才受到嫉妒的中伤。

sentences.english: Rain and snow don't penalize your Spot and Search checks.
sentences.chinese: 你的侦察和搜寻检定不再因雨和雪受到处罚。

sentences.english: Everyone feels resentment at being treated unfairly.
sentences.chinese: 每个人都会为受到不公平的待遇而感到愤慨。

sentences.english: You are already too locked in to a vendor-specific standard.
sentences.chinese: 已经受到特定供应商的标准的太多约束。

sentences.english: The Texas system challenged by Ms. Fisher is idiosyncratic.
sentences.chinese: 受到费舍女士挑战的德克萨斯录取系统非常特别。

sentences.english: He was given a dry reception.
He was caught by an avalanche and was seriously concussed.
sentences.chinese: 他碰到雪崩，受到严重的脑震荡。

sentences.english: The tradeoff is that you take nonlethal damage when you invoke it.
sentences.chinese: 代价是你使用的时候会不停受到淤伤。

sentences.english: As time gose by, man is making the earth sike .
sentences.chinese: 随着时间的推移，人类正在令地球受到破坏。

sentences.english: A dead body revenges not injuries.
sentences.chinese: 只有尸体才不会为受到的外伤而报复。

sentences.english: The roads and aqueducts of Rome have been the admiration of all after ages.
sentences.chinese: 古罗马的大道和高架渠在其后的年代一直受到羡慕。

definition: to receive/to accept/to suffer/subjected to/to bear/to stand/pleasant/(passive marker)
to receive in no small measure
to endure/to suffer/to be subjected to

quilt/by/(indicates passive-voice clauses)/(literary) to cover/to meet with/(coll.) (since c. 2009) used before a verb that does not accurately represent what actually happened, to describe with black humor how sb or sth was dealt with by the authorities (as in 被自殺|被自杀[bei4 zi4 sha1])
a craze/a popular wave/a hit with the public
(lit.) to fix one's gaze on/(fig.) to show interest in/(favorable) attention/favor
to lead to/to trigger/to initiate/to cause/to evoke (emotions)
to give rise to/to lead to/to cause/to arouse
